thread.title: Meet some of the first people to become American citizens under President Trump
thread.title_full: Meet some of the first people to become American citizens under President Trump – VICE News

author: Vice News
title: Meet some of the first people to become American citizens under President Trump
text:
Meet some of the first people to become American citizens under President Trump By Vice News on Feb 10, 2017 This segment originally aired Feb. 3, 2016, on VICE News Tonight on HBO.
America’s newest citizens are arriving at a time when their new country is going through tumultuous change. VICE News went to see some of the first people to become U.S. citizens under President Trump, and spoke to them about becoming citizens.
“My name is Merle Pereira. I’m originally from India, and I want to be an American citizen because I’ve been here for over 15 years, and I’m just really thankful I finally get to be official. I hope America realizes that it’s based on diversity.”
Many of the new American citizens addressed the president during our interviews. Here’s what one of those new citizens said:
“My name is Najib Adi, and I’m originally from Syria. I want to become an American citizen, and excited to be an American citizen, because everybody wants to experience the American dream I guess. I have a very good message for President Trump: Syrian immigrants are hard working, dedicated, loving immigrants, and they make great citizens, from Steve Jobs all the way down.”
